traversalConstraints.sourceText: [{'condition': 'Failure to meet inclusion/exclusion criteria', 'path': ['SCREENING', 'RE-SCREENING']}, {'condition': 'Adverse Event or Study Treatment Discontinuation', 'path': ['EARLY_TERMINATION', 'SAFETY_FOLLOW_UP']}, {'condition': 'Participation in optional substudy', 'path': ['EXPLORATORY_SUBSTUDY']}]

executionTypes.rationale: The primary efficacy objective is evaluated at a specific primary endpoint timepoint.
Protocol states missed PK samples may be obtained at the next scheduled visit, indicating a recurring collection schedule.
Protocol indicates ADA samples are obtained at scheduled visits throughout the study.

executionTypes.activityId: National Eye Institute 25-Item Visual Functioning Questionnaire (NEI VFQ-25)
executionTypes.rationale: Administration of the questionnaire is clarified as a repeated assessment during the trial.
Sites must confirm temperature conditions were maintained during the transit window from shipment to arrival.
Conditional workflow where the patient must inform the investigator only if the event (pregnancy) occurs.
One-time activity performed prior to study participation.

footnoteConditions.text: a. The screening and Day 1 (randomization) visits may occur as a combined visit if all assessments are completed and evaluated within 2 business days.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary: Change from baseline in BCVA at Week 24
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Non-inferiority of faricimab Q4W compared with aflibercept Q4W at a 1-sided 0.025 significance level; Superiority at a 2-sided 0.05 significance level.
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Change from baseline in BCVA at Week 24

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Proportion of patients gaining >= 15 letters in BCVA
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: (Count of patients where (BCVA_Week_24 - BCVA_Baseline) >= 15) / Total patients in ITT population
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Comparison of faricimab vs aflibercept through Week 24
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Proportion of patients gaining >=15 letters in BCVA from baseline at Week 24

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Categorical BCVA Letter Gain
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: Count of patients meeting thresholds (>=15, >=10, >=5, or >0 letters) / Total patients
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Evaluation at specified timepoints through Week 24
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Proportion of patients gaining >=15, >=10, >=5, or >0 letters in BCVA from baseline at specified timepoints through Week 24

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Change from baseline in BCVA at specified timepoints
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Evaluation of faricimab vs aflibercept through Week 24
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Change from baseline in BCVA at specified timepoints through Week 24

derivedVariables.name: Change from baseline in BCVA at Week 24
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Not explicitly defined in text; typically last non-missing value prior to first dose

derivedVariables.name: Proportion of patients gaining >=15 letters in BCVA from baseline at Week 24
Proportion of patients achieving >=84 letters in BCVA
Change from baseline in central subfield thickness (CST)
Change from baseline in NEI VFQ-25 composite score
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Mean of subscale scores as defined by NEI VFQ-25 manual; Change = Score_at_timepoint - Score_at_Baseline

derivedVariables.name: Proportion of patients on a Q4W, Q8W, Q12W, or Q16W treatment interval
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Frequency of dosing at Week 72 based on PTI algorithm

derivedVariables.name: Number of study drug injections received from Week 24 through Week 72
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Sum of all injections administered between Week 24 and Week 72 inclusive

dosingRegimens.titrationSchedule: Personalized Treatment Interval (PTI) regimen starting in Part 2 (Week 20+)

visitWindows.sourceText: Change from baseline in BCVA at Week 24 Secondary Efficacy Objectives The secondary efficacy objective for Part 1 of this study (i.e., through Week 24) is to evaluate
Randomization and Visit Schedule........................................ 36 3.1.2 Compliance with Study Visits, Handling of Missed

Day 7 (3 days) evaluated by the masked investigator. At subsequent scheduled visits, patients will have predose safety assessments evaluated by the masked investigator prior to receiving study treatm
the primary endpoint at Week 24. Efficacy, safety, and pharmacokinetics of faricimab administered according to the personalized treatment interval (PTI) dosing regimen (i.e., from every 4 weeks [Q4W]
by the IxRS, skipping the dose at Week 28. 3.1.4.3 Faricimab Interruption at Faricimab Dosing Visits Starting from

Week 68, a sham procedure will be administered during study visits at which (according to the PTI dosing regimen) no faricimab treatment is administered. Only one eye will be assigned as the study eye
